member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.RefreshType
member.summary: Represents the values that specify when the data should be refreshed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.RefreshType.DataBind
member.summary: Data is refreshed while binding data.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.RefreshType.Drilldown
member.summary: Data is refreshed while performing drill operations.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType
member.summary: Represents the different types of charts available in library.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.Column
member.summary: A column chart compares values across categories. The series values are displayed as individual columns and grouped by category. The height of each column is determined by the series value.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.StackingColumn
member.summary: A stacked column chart displays the relationship of individual items to the whole, comparing the contributions of each value to a total across categories. The series values are stacked in a single column for each category. The height of each column is determined by the total of all series values for the category.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.StackingColumn100
member.summary: A column chart where multiple series are stacked vertically to fit 100% of the chart. If there is only one series in your chart, then all the column bars will fit to 100% of the chart.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.Bar
member.summary: A bar chart is a chart with rectangular bars of lengths proportional to that value that they represent. Bar charts are used for comparing two or more values.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.StackingBar
member.summary: A stacked bar chart displays the relationship of individual items to the whole, comparing the contributions of each value to a total across categories. The series values are stacked in a single column for each category. The height of each column is determined by the total of all series values for the category.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.StackingBar100
member.summary: A bar chart where multiple series are stacked horizontally to fit 100% of the chart. If there is only one series in chart, all the bars will fit to 100% of chart.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.Line
member.summary: A style of chart that is created by connecting a series of data points together with a line. This is the most basic type of chart used in finance and it is generally created by connecting a series of past prices together with a line.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.Spline
member.summary: A spline chart is simply a line chart that plots a fitted curve through each data point in a series.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.StepLine
member.summary: Step Line charts are line charts, with values drawn continuously and step by step without any gaps between them.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.Area
member.summary: Area chart is a type of presentation graphic that emphasizes a change in values by filling in the portion of the graph beneath the line connecting various data points.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.StackingArea
member.summary: Stacking area chart is a chart with Y values stacked over one another, in series order.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.SplineArea
member.summary: Spline area chart is an area chart, in which each chart is given a color to emphasize the relationships between the pieces of charted information.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.StepArea
member.summary: The step area chart consists of pairs of values (plotted as points) on a line for each series in the given dataset. Each pair of values consists of one date (value) and one numeric value. This chart will have one date or time (value) based axis (the domain axis) and one numeric axis (the range axis). Each line is drawn at a 90 degree angle from point to point. Each line will fill from the line to the bottom of the plot with its series color.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.Scatter
member.summary: A scatter type contains one or more scatter plots each of which use Cartesian co-ordinates to display values for two series values for a set of data. The data is displayed as a collection of points, each having the value of one variable determining the position on the horizontal axis and the value of the other variable determining the position on the vertical axis.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartType.Pie
member.summary: A pie chart also known as circle graph, is a circular chart divided into sectors, illustrating relative magnitudes or frequencies or percent. In a pie chart, the arc length of each sector (and consequently its central angle and chart), is proportional to the quantity it represents. Together, the sectors create a full disk. It is named for its resemblance to a pie which has been sliced.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartColorPalette
member.summary: Represents the different types of color palette available in library.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.UI.Xaml.PivotChart.PivotChartColorPalette.None
member.summary: No palette will be set

member.summary: Custom palette will be set, and color values will be taken from CustomBrushes collection.

member.summary: TomotoSpectram palette will be set

member.summary: RedChrome palette will be set
